text: Hello everybody!

Happy Tuesday and welcome to another giveaway
video.

Before I move on to the next giveaway, I have
to announce the winner of this beautiful Stashbelt.
The winner is...WAIT!
We have to do this right.
CanI get a drumroll please?!
Thank you!
Toura Hooper!!!

You said that you wanted the dark chocolate
brown belt, and you would be using on your
travels when you walk the Camino next year.
Awesome.
That is going to be so much fun.

Now you can rest assure that your money will
be hidden very well along with your precious
documents.
Congratulations Toura!
Please send me an email at kristenj@hopscotchtheglobe.com.
I'll out my email in the description box below.

Claim your giveaway prize and we will send
that to you ASAP.
Now, if you didn't win, it's okay.
I'm giving away something else!

A company called El Camino Bracelets contacted
me, and they make really cool travel bracelets.

It's kind of like the Pandora bracelet, but
for travellers.

As avid travellers themselves, the El Camino
team came up with these bracelets as a representation

of the unique journey every travellers has
had.

It is a representation of the path you have
travelled around the world.
Just a reminder right here on your wrist.

The bracelets are made from high strength
cord and the clasps, region and country steps
are hand polished using surgical grade steel.
Solid mahogany is used to make the spacers.

All of the bracelets are hand made in England,
and you can choose between a single or double

bracelet in the following colours: black,
turquoise, chestnut brown, purple, red, steel
blue and forest green.

I chose the forest green double bracelet which
you can see.

Now , I don't have every continent, country
or region I've been to on my bracelet quite

yet but I'm excited to keep collecting the
steps.

The places I do have on the bracelet right
now are extra special.

I have Peru because it was the first trip
I took with Siya.

Thailand because it special to me and I've
been a few times.
I love it dearly.

I had some transformation experiences there
as well which I'll have to get into another
time.

Then I have Paraguay because it was the trip
that started my travel addiction.
Toronto.
Gotta represent!

Then, I have two continents on here: Asia
and Africa.
India of course!

It's my favourite country, and I had quite
the transformation there.
Now, here comes the fun part once again.

I am giving away one of these bracelets to
one of you!

What you will be getting is the El Camino
started package double bracelet that comes
with 2 countries of your choice.
We will also through in a region as well.

I also love the way that the bracelet came
packaged.

It came in this cute bag and each step came
in a cute box wrapped in tissue paper.
Great presentation.

To enter this giveaway, all you have to do
is subscribe to me on YouTube and follow me
on Instagram and Twitter.

Also, tell us in the comments below which
2 country steps you would choose.

I am all for supporting independent artists,
so when the El Camino team emailed me and

asked I could check out their bracelet, I
said I would absolutely love to, thatI loved

the idea however, I would have to give one
away to one of you!
I'll see you all on Thursday.
Good luck and happy travels!
